He activated his God’s Domain, his consciousness expanding, his divine sense flaring out, searching for the source of the threat.
But before he could even turn his gaze, the universe shook. His entire God space, his new universe, shuddered so violently that planets cracked and his manifested suns flickered.
Sunny leaped from his throne, his divine form crackling with power, his heart hammering in his chest. "This strength... The Demon Gods are here!"

chapters.title: Chapter 221: Ch 221 : Silencing The Demon Gods
chapters.content:
Chapter 221: Ch 221 : Silencing The Demon Gods
For centuries, the hunt had been a cold, boring, and fruitless affair. Out of the 20,000 demon gods, twenty-six demon gods, a pack of predators unleashed by Deimos’s decree, had swept through this sector of the multiverse and found nothing.
The new Gods, the ones born from Adam’s artifact, were cowards. They had hidden themselves away, their worlds hidden by some unknown power, leaving the hunters to starve in an empty space.
This endless search had made them irritable. It had made them angry. In their boredom, they had taken to committing casual atrocities; extinguishing suns, consuming the lifeforms of entire Godless planets, and torturing these poor souls just to pass the boredom.
Then, they found it.
A scent. A faint whisper of divine energy in a part of the void that should have been empty. It was a trail of life, a beacon of such overwhelming power that it pulled at their very souls.
They followed it, a pack of starved wolves drawn to a living feast. And they found its source.
"Haha, finally!" a voice like a roaring furnace echoed in the silent void. "A planet, protected by a God! This one is mine, brothers! I discovered it!"
The speaker was Kash, a being of pure, sentient, malevolent energy.
He was a Legion-Born, a demigod birthed by the Demonic Realm itself, his form a swirling vortex of purple fire, a crown of shadowflame on his head, his ’body’ was a core of burning malice.
He and his 25 allies had found the source of the divine energy: a colossal, vibrant planet, larger than a star, radiating an aura of life so potent it was almost making them drool. It was Veridia.
"You wish, Kash," a new voice rumbled, a sound so deep and vast it seemed to shake the very fabric of space. This voice did not come from the pack; it came from the darkness behind them.
A new figure emerged, and the other 26 demon gods, including the fiery Kash, instantly recoiled, their arrogant auras dimming to a respectful flicker.
The newcomer was colossal, so large that Veridia looked like a mere marble at its feet. Its form was a perfect symmetry.
One half of its body was a pristine, polished white, like divine porcelain. The other half was a deep, light-devouring black, a patch of absolute void.
Golden veins, pulsing with a sick, unholy power, snaked across both halves, stitching them together.
Where a face should be, there were only two, perfectly circular, glowing red holes for eyes, and a permanent, crooked, glowing red line for a mouth; a smile that stretched from ear to ear, a show of insanity.
This was Edgar, also known as "Death" in the demonic realm. He, too, was a Legion-Born, but he was many league above Kash.
"We found this planet at the same time, little flame," Edgar’s smiling mouth did not move, but his voice echoed in their minds. "But as I am stronger, I will be the one to have the fun here. All of you... get lost."
"Edgar... you..." Kash’s purple flames sputtered with rage. He was a Legion-Born, a being of immense pride. He would not be dismissed like a common cur.
But as he looked at the overwhelming size of Edgar, at the cold, red, unblinking circles that passed for eyes, his anger was choked by a cold fear.
He knew, without a single doubt, that if he fought Edgar, he would not just be defeated; he would be erased. He bowed his fiery head in a gesture of submission.
Inside the shimmering, invisible barrier of the God’s Domain, Sunny and Adam stood on the surface of Veridia’s moon, observing the silent, terrifying gathering of their new "guests."
"Quite a few ugly bastards have come to knock on our door, Adam," Sunny said, his voice a casual hum.
His God’s Eye was already at work, scanning, analyzing, and categorizing. He could feel the power radiating from the 27 demons.
Twenty-five of them were cannon fodder, lesser demon gods that his subordinates could likely handle. But the two in the front... they were different. They were monsters on a completely different level.
"I know the white and black one," Adam’s voice was a low, grim rumble, his eyes fixed on the colossal figure of Edgar. "His name is Edgar. He was just a lesser demon god during the great war, a minor nuisance. But the power I feel from him now... he has grown strong, Cosmos. He is one of their top-tier Demon God."
Adam turned to Sunny, his face a mask of worry. "My strength is still returning. I can handle the 26 rabble. But Edgar... in my current state, I cannot fight him."
He looked at the masked Emperor, the being who had repelled a Void Beast. "Can you take him?"
Sunny’s cosmic mask was unreadable. He felt the cold, oppressive aura of Edgar, a power that seemed to want to erase the very laws of life.
But his Divine Intuition, the talent that had screamed in terror at the sight of the Void Beast, was now... quiet.
Sunny gave a single, slight nod. "I will take Edgar. You handle the others."
"Ants!" Edgar’s voice suddenly boomed, a roar that smashed against the God’s Domain barrier, a sound that made the invisible wall shimmer and drain a trillion faith from Sunny’s reserves.
"Submit to me now, and I shall grant you the mercy of a painless death! Resist, and I will devour your world, one screaming soul at a time!"
The other 26 demon gods laughed, a chorus of cruel sound.
Sunny just looked at them. He raised a hand in a simple gesture of annoyance.
And he spoke.
"Shut up."
His voice was a calm, simple command, spoken with the absolute authority of his Divine Command. It was a law.
Instantly, the 25 "fodder" demon gods froze. Their mouths, open in a chorus of mocking laughter, snapped shut. They grabbed at their throats, their eyes wide with terror.
The very concept of speech, of sound, had been stolen from them. They were trapped in a prison of silence, unable to even scream.
But the two Legion-Born fought.
Edgar’s colossal form shuddered, the golden veins on his body pulsing with a defiant light. He strained against this new law, his entire being pushing back against Sunny’s will.
With the force of a collapsing star, he tore his "mouth" open and forced a single sound from his being. "Hmph," he growled. "Petty tricks."
Kash, the weaker of the two, had it harder. His purple flames sputtered and dimmed, his entire form convulsing as he fought the command.
He clawed at his own fiery throat, finally, with an agonizing effort, he managed to stammer, his voice a pathetic whisper: "Y-yeah... p-petty... t-tricks."
This single, two-word exchange had established the power hierarchy of the new war.
In their own God spaces, the 6 billion Gods of the Pantheon, let out a collective gasp, they wanted to know the cause of these tremors.
In the end they decided to ask Thea about what was going on in the space, what was the reason for this sudden oppressive aura.
Thea, couldn’t just show them what was happening without the permission of Sunny, thus she mentally told her master about the questions from the Gods.
"They wanted to know what is happening," he said, his voice calm. "I believe it is only right to show them."
Thea showed what Sunny had done just now, through the recording, which shook all the 6 billion Gods.
Their Emperor... their Emperor had just silenced an army of ancient, terrifying demon gods with two words.
The fear that had been coiling in their souls of the demons, was suddenly replaced by a new, fanatical awe for their new master.
Sunny, feeling the sudden surge of faith from his awestruck followers, smiled as he looked at the enormous Edgar.

chapters.title: Chapter 222: Ch 222 : Let me show you, why we are called as Gods
chapters.content:
Chapter 222: Ch 222 : Let me show you, why we are called as Gods
The six billion Gods of the Pantheon, watching the live broadcast from the safety of their God spaces, were completely silent.
The shock of what they had just witnessed; their Emperor, God Cosmos, silencing an army of twenty-seven ancient demon gods with two casual words, was still settling in.
But their awe was quickly replaced by a new terror. They watched as the two leaders of the demonic pack, the colossal Edgar and the fiery Kash, broke the law.
They watched them struggle against that command, their forms convulsing, and then, with a final effort, they freeed themselves from the Emperor’s will.
A ripple of fear went through the Pantheon. Their Emperor was mighty, yes. But he was not perfect. These... Beings... were on another level entirely.
This realization, this first taste of the real war, did not break their spirit. This made them even more resolute.
In the God space of Asura, the God of the Kshara planet, a righteous fury ignited within him. He stood from his throne.
"Thea," he commanded, his voice a low rumble. "Send me to my Emperor. The time for watching is over."
In another God space, Zir, his face a mask of fanatical loyalty, was already standing. "What are you waiting for, Thea?! The Boss is in a fight! Send me in!"
Joker too stood up from his throne and said, "Oh, this is a real party. 27 demon gods, and two of them are even at the same level as emperor." He too stood, a wicked grin on his face. "Count me in, Thea. I want a front-row seat."
Nyx, Reflection, Strategist... one by one, the sixteen Gods who thought of themselves as capable of fighting these demons began to request Thea to send them into the space.
They were not just subjects. They were the Emperor’s sword, and they would not stand idly by while their leader faced the darkness alone.
[Master,] Thea’s voice chimed in Sunny’s mind, a hint of something he could only describe as pride in her tone.
[Sixteen Gods wish to join the battle. Should I guide them through the portals?]
A grin spread across Sunny’s face, hidden behind his mask. "Why not?" he murmured, his gaze fixed on the twenty-seven demons. "They aren’t going to die anyway."
The Divine Immortality he had gifted them, the nine lives he had bestowed, was a blessing that could only be used in such occasions "Let them come, Thea. Let them have their fun."
Adam, standing beside him, his eyes blazing with a fire, let out a proud laugh. His million year long gambit, his desperate, final act that had created this new generation of Gods, was finally, finally bearing fruit.
Sixteen portals tore open in the space behind Sunny and Adam. From them, the Gods who wished to fight for glory and pride emerged.
"Haha! And here I thought there were only two of you!" Edgar’s voice boomed, his colossal form looming over them, his crooked red smile seeming to widen in delight. "Now, it is a true feast! So many new, delicious little Gods to consume!"
Sunny’s cosmic gaze remained fixed on the giant. He could not get any information. His God’s Eye, which could pierce the veil of any being below him, was useless against Edgar and Kash.
Their power, their very existence, was a mystery. He would have to be vigilant.
"The plan is simple," Sunny’s voice echoed directly in the minds of his allies. "Adam will take the fiery one. I will take Edgar." He turned his gaze to the sixteen newly arrived Gods. "The rest... are yours. Show me what the Gods of my Pantheon are made of."
"With pleasure, Emperor," Asura’s voice rumbled as his eyes, blazing with a righteous fire, locked onto a hulking, four-armed demon god.
"This is going to be expensive," Joker muttered, already calculating the faith-cost of the spells he was about to unleash.
But his face showed a hidden grin as he knew that he could get back that amount after making fun of these demon gods, and possibly some of the gods too.
A multi-front war ignited in the dark space. Adam, roaring with the pent-up fury of a million years, shot toward Kash like a golden comet.
The sixteen Gods descended upon the 25 terrified, and now silenced, demon gods, their battle a chaotic, beautiful explosion of a hundred different laws and powers.
And Sunny... Sunny was left alone, floating in the void, facing the colossal and utterly terrifying form of Edgar.
"You sure talk big" Sunny said, his voice calm as he looked at Edgar. He raised a single hand. "Let me show you why we are called as Gods"
He decided to begin this fight with a declaration of overwhelming power. He activated his God’s Authority, which was now good enough to use two talents at the same time, and the two talents that Sunny was using were: Nova’s Charged Explosion and Mammon’s Talent Resonance.
Using talent resonance he wove all of his talents; his Time Affinity, his Magic Affinity, and the very authority of his God’s Domain; into a complex, and lethal framework.
Then, he poured the fuel into that framework. He opened the floodgates of his Charged Explosion talent, unleashing the stored, cumulative power of his entire empire.
The power of every lifeform’s breakthrough, every champion’s victory in the tournament, every new birth, every prayer of hope; a torrent of energy surged into the weapon he had just forged.
The void itself screamed. An ethereal hand, a hand so colossal it dwarfed even the gigantic Edgar, materialized in the space above him.
This was a hand of law. A swirling, multi-colored hand, its "veins" a river of white-gold, explosive energy, its "skin" a tapestry of a dozen different SS-Grade talents.
Edgar, the Legion-Born demon, looked up. And for the first time in his long existence, the glowing, red, circular holes widened in what could only be described as shock.
He tried to defend. He raised his own massive, black-and-white arms, a shield of his own law forming in front of him.
Sunny’s hand descended.
Edgar’s shield dissolved. The Hand plunged into his colossal chest with grace. A spray of golden blood erupted from his back.
But Sunny wasn’t done. He raised his other hand.
A second Cosmic Hand, an identical twin of the first, formed in the void below Edgar.
He clenched his fists. The two hands, one of heaven, one of earth, clapped together. They crushed the demon god between them.
A multi-colored explosion of light erupted in the void. The shockwave shot across the battlefield.
The 25 demon gods, who had just been engaging with the Pantheon, were sent tumbling, their forms flickering, their silent screams of terror echoing in the minds of all present.
Sunny stood in the center of the destruction, his cosmic robe swirling. He looked at the dissipating cloud of black-and-white energy, the last remnant of the demon.
"Are you dead?" he called out, his voice laced with a cold, mocking tone. "Even a bug doesn’t die that soon. Stand up."
The golden blood, which had been floating lifelessly in the void, stopped. It reversed its course. It flew back to a single, central point.
The black-and-white energy, which had been dissipating, began to take shape. Edgar’s colossal form reformed, his body a mangled, a massive, gaping, hand-shaped hole in his chest.
But he was alive. And the crooked, red, smiling line on his face was wider, more manic, more terrifying, than ever.
"Good... good..." Edgar’s voice echoed, no longer a taunt, but a rumble of hunger. "You do have some skills, bug. But you made one, fatal mistake"
He raised his own black-and-white hand. The black energy, the white light, the golden veins... they all began to swirl. As a cosmic hand similar to what Sunny had made began to form in the space above him.
"Damn..." Sunny whispered, a genuine flicker of dread in his soul.
The Gods in their spaces, watching on the live feed, screamed. Adam, locked in a furious battle with Kash, froze, his face going pale.
The demonic hand descended, aimed not just at Sunny, but at Veridia, at the heart of the God’s Domain.

chapters.title: Chapter 223: Ch 223 : A new idea
chapters.content:
Chapter 223: Ch 223 : A new idea
The colossal, demonic hand, a perfect mirror of Sunny’s own attack, descended from the void.
It moved with a slow and unstoppable grace. It was not just an attack; it was a mockery, a declaration from Edgar that anything Sunny could create, he could corrupt and use as his.
The six billion Gods watching this horrifying spectacle through Thea’s live broadcast, felt an existential dread.
This hand was not aimed at them, but they felt as if it were. It was a force that seemed to transcend the very concept of defense, a power so vast that even their nine gifted lives felt like a meaningless, fleeting comfort.
Sunny and Adam, however, stood their ground, their divine forms blazing in the shadow of the descending mountain.
They stared at the barrier of the God’s Domain; their last wall of defence that had, just hours before, repelled the hunger of a Void Beast.
"It’s horrifying," Adam admitted, his voice a low rumble, "but your barrier held against the Void beast. It will be able to hold against this too. The only question is the cost."
Sunny nodded, his mind a already attempting to count the faith drain.
He never finished the thought.
The hand, a swirling galaxy of concepts, touched the barrier.
And passed through.
There was not even a slightest of resistance. The Cosmic Hand, an attack forged from Sunny’s own divine laws, simply phased through the God’s Domain as if it were not even there.
In that single instant, the entire multiverse froze.
Sunny’s mind went blank, a void of shock. Adam’s eyes widened in dawning horror.
The barrier, their ultimate defense, the very thing that protected their entire territory, their worlds, and the quadrillions of lifeforms within... had failed.
"Look at your face, little bug," Edgar’s voice echoed, a sound of malice. "You were talking so big just now."
As if to punctuate his victory, Edgar, with a lazy, almost casual gesture, raised his second hand.
From the void below Sunny, an identical hand of corrupted law erupted, its palm open, a mirror to the one descending from above.
Sunny’s mind, and the minds of his fourteen clones, exploded into a storm of calculations, running a million simulations per second. ’Why? How?!’ He tried to activate his Time Affinity, to slow the descent, to buy himself a single second to think.
But the hands, forged from his own laws, were already imbued with his Time Affinity.
They existed in their own temporal state, immune to his will. He couldn’t slow them down. He couldn’t counter them with a normal spell; that wouldn’t affect it any ways.
This was an unsolvable riddle.
The two hands, one from above and one from below, closed in, their shadows converging on Sunny, Adam, and the 16 allied Gods who had bravely, and perhaps foolishly, joined the fight.
There was only one path left. The one he hated because of the faith drain.
Sunny raised his head, his cosmic eyes blazing with a cold, furious light.
He spoke a single, divine command, a word that cost him more than the creation of a thousand demigods, a word that ripped one quadrillion faith points from his reserves in a single instant.
"DISAPPEAR."
The universe screamed. The two descending hands suddenly stuttered.
They were laws, yes, but this was a decree. A higher authority, backed by a quadrillion-faith point, a surge of will, had just ordered them to cease existing.
The hands tore at the seams, the beautiful, swirling lights of their laws unraveling like threads from a tapestry. And then, in a final, silent implosion, they dissolved into nothingness.
A heavy, panting silence fell over the void. Sunny’s reserves, once a mighty ocean of 4 quadrillions, were now looking a little shallow.
"Why... why didn’t the barrier work?" Adam’s voice was a whisper beside him, his gaze fixed on the spot where the hands had been.
"It wasn’t his law that bypassed it," Sunny said, his mind replaying the event, the logic behind his own failure. "It was mine."
The confused looks from his subordinates were palpable.
"My command to the God’s Domain during the Void Beast attack was simple," Sunny explained, his voice cold.
"Do not let any enemy or any enemy attack enter my territory." He let the words sink in.
"That hand, Edgar’s attack... it wasn’t his. It was mine. He didn’t create an attack; he just... returned mine. The barrier analyzed the signature, saw my laws, my energy and it did its job perfectly. It recognized the attack as friendly... as internal... and it let it pass right through."
He now understood. Edgar’s power wasn’t just mimicry. It was something far more terrifying.
It was similar to Thorns, an ability to absorb, store, and return any attack, any law, any concept, thrown at him.
When Sunny had hit him with that Cosmic Hand, Edgar had eaten it.
The implications were chilling.
What else had this creature "eaten" in its long, horrifying existence? Had it survived an attack from the demon lords? From a Void Beast? Did it now hold those powers in reserve, waiting to unleash them?
"So, that means... we can’t attack him," Adam said, his voice grim as he effortlessly plucked the fiery hair from a struggling, bound Kash.
While Sunny and Edgar had their duel, he and the 16 Gods had successfully, and almost easily, captured the other 26 demon gods. Edgar was now alone.
"We can," Sunny said mentally to Adam, not wanting Edgar to overhear his weakness, "but the attack must be a one-hit kill. We cannot give him the chance to absorb and return a second blow."
"I was right, you are a little special?" Edgar’s voice boomed, his crooked red smile twisting with glee.
He had seen the terror in their eyes, the shock, the dawning realization. "There’s much more to come, little bugs. You haven’t even seen anything yet!"
He raised his hand, and a new, different energy gathered; a wave of malecious energy.
It was not Sunny’s. It was something dark, ancient, and filled with a killing intent that made the Gods shiver. He hurled it at the barrier.
SPLATTER.
The attack, a roiling ball of black energy, hit the God’s Domain and splattered, dissolving harmlessly against the invisible wall.
"See?" Sunny said, a grim satisfaction in his voice as he felt the barrier drain a mere hundred billion faith to block the "normal" attack.
"That attack was from some other demon he devoured. My barrier can stop those powers, It just can’t stop mine."
"Oh?!" Edgar’s red, circular eyes widened in genuine surprise. His focus, which had been on Sunny, now shifted to the invisible barrier that had just repelled his attack. "A barrier? How cute."
He lunged with fury. His white-and-black fist, sith the size of a stars, slammed into the God’s Domain.
BOOM.
Sunny’s entire body recoiled, a trillion faith points vanishing from his reserves in a single, painful instant.
BOOM. Another punch. Another trillion gone. BOOM. BOOM. BOOM.
Edgar had become a furious punching machine, pummelling the invisible wall, and with every single punch, he was draining the faith of Sunny like water.
"How many hits like that can you take?" Adam asked, his voice now laced with a desperate urgency.
"Probably... a few hundred, at most," Sunny replied, his own mind racing, his clones too were busy thinking about any solution.
The situation was, once again, impossible. They couldn’t attack him. But they also couldn’t let him attack them.
They were trapped, forced to sit and watch as this monster beat them into bankruptcy. ’We can’t attack him... what can we even do?’
But then, Sunny, his God’s Eye enhanced by his Domain’s omniscience, noticed something.
A tiny, almost imperceptible detail that the other Gods, in their panic, had missed.
With every thunderous, trillion-faith-costing punch Edgar threw, his own star-sized body was... shrinking.
It was a minuscule change, a few centimeters at a time, but it was constant.
A new path, a new bold strategy, began to form in Sunny’s mind.

chapters.title: Chapter 224: Ch 224 : Vengeance
chapters.content:
Chapter 224: Ch 224 : Vengeance
In the dark, oppressive meeting hall of the demon lords, the five Demon Lords sat in council.
An ethereal projection, a wisp of corrupted energy, floated in the center of their bone table, replaying a scene of chaotic power.
It showed the figure of Edgar, locked in a brutal duel with a masked God.
"Edgar is fighting Cosmos?" Deimos’s voice was a low hum, his usual calm replaced by a flicker of genuine surprise.
He watched the report, sent by a lesser demon god who was observing the battle from a safe distance.
"He is not just fighting, Deimos," Beelzebub rumbled, his voice a low growl in hunger "He is winning. That little toy of yours, the one you’ve been so interested in, he may break before he is even fully developed."
"Do we stop Edgar?" Phobos rasped, the hundred terrified faces swirling in his shadowy form all turning to look at their leader.
Deimos watched the projection, his gaze unreadable. He saw Sunny’s brilliant counter-attack.
He saw Edgar’s mocking mimicry. He saw the barrier fail. He saw the Emperor of the Pantheon, the being who had eluded him for a million years, trapped. A slow, cold smile spread across his face.
"No," he said finally, his voice a final verdict. "This is his test. If he cannot handle even a single, over-eager Legion-Born, then he is not the opponent I have been waiting for. He should rather die." Deimos closed the report, the projection vanishing, and stood, his gaze capturing all the darkness in the vast hall.
Far away, in a different multiverse, two other Demon Lords stood before a defeated king.
The world around them was a dying husk, the skies a sick, yellow-green, the very air thin and choked with the scent of decay.
The Zerg, once a teeming, unstoppable tide, were gone, most of their population having migrated to a richer multiverse.
All that remained was their dying God, who chose to protect their home multiverse.
"You think you know our weaknesses?" Ichor, the Demon Lord of Corrosion, sneered, his slimy, acidic form pulsing with a mocking light. "That is pretty lame, insect."
He and Maledictus, the Demon lord of Curses, had come to this multiverse expecting a war.
Instead, they had found a near empty multiverse, an empire ruled by a single God, while the two new Gods were out in the multiverse of resources, as Maledictus has said earlier.
"You will regret this," the Zerg God, Voragos, hissed, his insectoid body, once a magnificent fortress of muscle, now battered and broken.
His three remaining eyes burned with helpless fury. "My son... Beru... he is the chosen one of the heavens. He will make our race... our race..."
SLAP!
Ichor’s slimy hand, crackling with corrosive energy, lashed out. The slap sent Voragos flying.
His body shot across half a universe, crashing through dead, abandoned planets before finally coming to a stop in the empty void.
"Your son?" Ichor’s voice echoed in his mind, dripping with poison. "We are going to the Multiverse of Resources next, insect. And I will personally find your precious, chosen son. I will kill him. I will eat his flesh. And I will make him watch as I devour your soul. Then, you can see him in the afterlife."
Ichor dissolved into a streak of acidic light, hurtling across the cosmos to finish his prey.
Voragos floated in the void. He looked at the incoming Ichor. He had no power left to fight. But he had one, final act of defiance.
He gathered the last, fading embers of his divine will, and he screamed.
It was a message. An inaudible screech, a telepathic broadcast that contained all his love, all his rage, and his final hope.
It shot through his own multiverse, bypassed the barrier, and lanced across the infinite void, aimed at a single mind.
In the Multiverse of Resources, an ant-like, humanoid insect, taller than any human, his dark-red carapace gleaming with power, suddenly froze.
His two long, sensitive antennae, which had been idly tasting the rich, mana-filled air, twitched violently.
The message, a scream from a dying God, from his father, pierced his mind.
He heard it all. The arrival of the Demon Lords. The defeat. The final, defiant message of his father’s last moments.
He looked up at the sky, his eyes, once calm, now burning with a grief so profound it became a physical fire. His father was dead.
"I WILL KILL THEM ALL!" he roared, his voice an inhuman sound of vengeance. "I will eat their flesh! I will drink their blood! I will... I will..."
His words failed him, his grief too vast to be contained in a simple threat.
He was Beru, the Crown Prince of the Zerg. And he was now an orphan.
"I will evolve," he whispered, his promise now a sacred oath. "I will evolve past the very Gods of Insects from the legends. I will evolve until I can devour the Demon Lords themselves."
A pair of shimmering ant-wings erupted from his back, and he shot into the sky, a comet of rage. He knew he was not strong enough. Not yet. He had to run. He had to hide. He had to grow.
As he flew, he sent his own telepathic message, to his only true friend, another anomaly from his multiverse.
"Brother Suba! Run! The Demon Lords... they are coming to find us!"
Far away, in another corner of the multiverse, a different, newly ascended Zerg God, his form a strange, mutated fusion of insect and something... else... paused his own exploration. "My Prince? Is your father, the King, alright?"
"He is dead," Beru’s message was a shard of ice in Suba’s mind. "We are the only ones left who can avenge him now."
For a few, agonizing seconds, there was no reply. Then, Suba’s voice returned, his tone no longer curious, but filled with a grim, terrible resignation.
"Brother Beru... my Prince... I think they have already sensed me. I can feel their... gaze. You must hide. Do not stop. Do not look back."
"Suba, no! We can fight—"
"We can’t. Not yet. When you reach the edge of this multiverse," Suba’s voice continued, calm yet hurried, "open the box I gave you. It will help you break the barrier. Go. Live, my Prince."
And then, the connection was cut.
Beru, the last son of a fallen King, felt his heart, a complex, alien organ, shatter.
His father was dead. His only brother-in-arms was about to be.
This defeat, this helplessness, did not dim the fire of his vengeance. It fanned it, turning it from a simple flame into a raging inferno.
His anger, his grief, his pain; it all became fuel, and his body burned it, accelerating him, pushing him towards the edge of the multiverse, towards the unknown, at a speed he had never known he possessed.
